directions: Prepare the soil by removing any rocks or debris.
Dig trenches about 30 centimeters apart and 20 centimeters deep.
Plant the potato seeds in the trenches, spacing them about 30 centimeters apart.
Cover the seeds with soil and water thoroughly.
Once the potato plants have grown to about 15 centimeters tall, add fertilizer and water regularly.
Continue to water and care for the plants as they grow.
Harvest the potatoes when they have reached the desired size, usually around 2-3 months after planting.
Gently dig up the potatoes from the soil, being careful not to damage them.
Store the harvested potatoes in a cool, dark place until ready to use.
